intro: Promenaea catharinensis, commonly known as the Brazilian violet, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
